content: सद् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> ({c6c} <ab>P.</ab> also according to some) (सीदति, सन्न; the स् of सद् is changed to ष् after any preposition ending in इ or उ except प्रति) {@--1@} To sit, sit down, recline, lie, lie down, rest, settle; अमदाः सेदुरेकस्मिन् नितंबे निखिला गिरेः <ls>Bk. 7. 58.</ls> {@--2@} To sink down, plunge into; तेन त्वं विदुषां मध्ये पंके गौरिव सीदसि <ls>H. Pr. 24</ls>; (where the word has sense 4 also). {@--3@} To live, remain, reside, dwell. {@--4@} To be dejected or low-spirited, despond, despair, sink into despondency; नाथ हरे जय नाथ हरे सीदति राधा वासगृहे <ls>Gīt. 6.</ls> {@--5@} To decay, perish, go to ruin, waste away, be destroyed; विपन्नायां नीतौ सकलमवशं सीदति जगत् <ls>H. 2. 77</ls>; तं सन्नशत्रुं ददृशुः स्वयोधाः <ls>R. 7. 64</ls>; <ls>H. 2. 130.</ls> {@--6@} To be in distress, be pained or afflicted, be helpless; <ls>Ki. 13. 60</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 21.</ls> {@--7@} To be impeded or hindered; <ls>Ms. 9. 94.</ls> {@--8@} To be languid, be wearied or fatigued, droop, sink; सीदति मे हृदयं <ls>K.</ls>; सीदंति मम गात्राणि <ls>Bg. 1. 28.</ls> {@--9@} To go. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (सादयति-ते) {@--1@} To cause to sit down, rest. {@--2@} To throw or cast down, place, put. {@--3@} To weary, exhaust. {@--4@} To cause to perish, destroy. {%--<ab>Desid.</ab>%} (सिषत्सति) To wish to sit &c.
